solution_line_template: There are {hours_to_consider} x {minutes_per_hour} minutes = <<{hours_to_consider}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_minutes_in_hour}>>{total_minutes_in_hour} minutes in {hours_to_consider} hour.

There are {total_minutes_in_hour}/{jane_time_per_set} = <<{total_minutes_in_hour}/{jane_time_per_set}={jane_sets_per_hour}>>{jane_sets_per_hour} sets of {jane_time_per_set} minutes in {hours_to_consider} hour.
So, Jane can fold {jane_towels_per_set} x {jane_sets_per_hour} = <<{jane_towels_per_set}*{jane_sets_per_hour}={jane_towels_per_hour}>>{jane_towels_per_hour} towels in an hour.

There are {total_minutes_in_hour}/{kyla_time_per_set} = <<{total_minutes_in_hour}/{kyla_time_per_set}={kyla_sets_per_hour}>>{kyla_sets_per_hour} sets of {kyla_time_per_set} minutes in {hours_to_consider} hour.
So, Kyla can fold {kyla_towels_per_set} x {kyla_sets_per_hour} = <<{kyla_towels_per_set}*{kyla_sets_per_hour}={kyla_towels_per_hour}>>{kyla_towels_per_hour} towels in an hour.

There are {total_minutes_in_hour}/{anthony_time_per_set} = <<{total_minutes_in_hour}/{anthony_time_per_set}={anthony_sets_per_hour}>>{anthony_sets_per_hour} sets of {anthony_time_per_set} minutes in {hours_to_consider} hour.
So, Anthony can fold {anthony_towels_per_set} x {anthony_sets_per_hour} = <<{anthony_towels_per_set}*{anthony_sets_per_hour}={anthony_towels_per_hour}>>{anthony_towels_per_hour} towels in an hour.

Therefore, the 3 of them can fold a total of {jane_towels_per_hour} + {kyla_towels_per_hour} + {anthony_towels_per_hour} = <<{jane_towels_per_hour}+{kyla_towels_per_hour}+{anthony_towels_per_hour}={total_towels_per_hour}>>{total_towels_per_hour} towels in {hours_to_consider} hour.
